meanings.definition: The act of attaching hobnails to the sole of a shoe for added traction.
meanings.sent1: Hobnailing can make shoes less slippery.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler recommended hobnailing for the new boots.
meanings.sent3: The sound of hobnailing echoed through the cobblestone street.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the hobnailing of a thousand shoes.
meanings.sent5: The hobnailing on his boots gleamed in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A shoe with hobnails attached for added durability.
meanings.sent1: Grandpa's old boots had hobnailing for strength.
meanings.sent2: The military issued hobnailing boots for rough terrain.
meanings.sent3: The hobnailing on the shoes made them look rugged.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as tough as the hobnailing on her favorite shoes.
meanings.sent5: The hobnailing on the work boots was worn from years of use.

meanings.definition: To hobnail a shoe for better grip on slippery surfaces.
meanings.sent1: He decided to hobnail his boots before the hiking trip.
meanings.sent2: Hobnailing the shoes was necessary for the icy path.
meanings.sent3: She joked that hobnailing was like giving shoes tiny spikes.
meanings.sent4: The idea of hobnailing his sneakers seemed strange but effective.
meanings.sent5: The shoemaker expertly hobnailed the worn-out soles.
